discworld
Class CityCard

java.lang.Object
  discworld.CityCard

public class CityCard
extends java.lang.Object

This class generates the city cards and owner of the city areas

Version:
3.00, 2 April 2015
Author:
Shu Liu, Mohit Pujara

Constructor Detail

CityCard

public CityCard(int id,
                java.lang.String name,
                byte[] nearestCity,
                int benefit)
Constructs an instance of CityCard class with the given parameters. This constructor will create a particular CityCard with the id, the name and the nearest cities to it.

Parameters:
id -
name -
nearestCity -
benefit -

CityCard

public CityCard(int id,
                java.lang.String name,
                int owner,
                java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> minions,
                boolean troublemaker,
                boolean building,
                int demons,
                int trolls,
                byte[] nearestCity,
                int benefit)
Constructs an instance of CityCard class with the given parameters. This constructor will create a particular CityCard with id, name. the owner, number of minions for each player, existence of trouble maker and building, number of demons and trolls

Parameters:
id - The id of the city
name - The name of the city
owner - The owner of the city
minions - Vector of minions records the minions for each player
troublemaker - Contains trouble maker or not
building - The city has build or not
demons - The city has demons or not
trolls - The city has trolls or not
nearestCity - Adjacent cities to the given city
benefit - The benefit a player can have by having a building at that city
Method Detail

putMinion

public boolean putMinion(Player p)
The method put the minions in the game. If the number of minions or demons or trolls in city area is more than or equal to one, then put a minion in this area.

Parameters:
p - The player whose minions is put in the city.
Returns:
If the player put a minion then return true, otherwise return false.

removeMinion

public boolean removeMinion(Player p)
This method is used for removing one minion for a player. If the number of minions is more than or equal to one, then remove a minion from the area; otherwise output there is no minion in this area.

Parameters:
p - The player whose minions is removed
Returns:
If the player' minions is removed then return true, otherwise return false.

putTM

public boolean putTM()
If there is no trouble maker in the city, then put one. Otherwise, output trouble maker exists.

Returns:
If trouble maker is put, then return true, otherwise return false.

removeTM

public boolean removeTM()
If there is a trouble maker in the city, then remove it; otherwise, output trouble maker does not exist.

Returns:
If trouble maker is removed, then return true, otherwise return false.

build

public boolean build(Player p)
If there is no building in the city, then build one for the player and change the owner for the city. Otherwise, output building exists.

Parameters:
p - The player who want to build a building.
Returns:
If building is built, then return true, otherwise return false.

destroy

public boolean destroy()
If there is a building in the city, then destroy one for the player and change the owner for the city. Otherwise, output building does not exists.

Returns:
If one building is destroyed, then return true.

putDemon

public boolean putDemon()
The method add demons in a specific city area. If the number of minions or demons or trolls in city area is more than or equal to one, then put a demon in this area.

Returns:
If the player put the demon in this area, then return true; otherwise return false.

removeDemon

public boolean removeDemon()
The method removes demons in a specific city area. If there is a demon in the city area, then remove a demon and a trouble maker; otherwise, output demon does not exist.

Returns:
If the player remove the demon in this area, then return true; otherwise return false.

putTrolls

public boolean putTrolls()
This method add trolls in the city. If the number of minions or demons or trolls in city area is more than or equal to one, then put a troll in this area.

Returns:
If the player put a troll in this area, then return true; otherwise return false.

removeTrolls

public boolean removeTrolls()
The method removes the trolls in a specific city area. If there is a troll in the city area, then remove a troll; otherwise, output troll does not exist.

Returns:
If the player remove a troll in this area, then return true; otherwise return false.

adjacentCheck

public boolean adjacentCheck(java.util.Vector<CityCard> CityCards,
                             Player p)
Checking the adjacent city that has minion or not.

Parameters:
CityCards - The city which is adjacent needs to check.
player - The player who plays the game
Returns:
If the adjacent city has minions, then return true; otherwise return false.
